sentences.text: FireFox / Youtube can Interrupt the Sound system

Even with Nice set at -90, surfing can shut down the sound system, even though the
Video playing from Youtube keeps being visible and playing (sound stops).
The only way to get the sound going again is to reload the Youtube Video.

Then its a matter of touching no keys / leaving the mouse alone, 
to hear the entire song through - frustrating !

I also notice that Gnome Alsa Mixer forgets the last settings 
when this Bug occurs.
Is there a save command on any of

Re: [Ubuntustudio-testers] [Bug 739634] [NEW] FireFox / Youtube can Interrupt the Sound system
This description resembles a kernel issue.
You can find out from `cat /proc/version*' in a Terminal/xterm.

Please
attach the output from that command (no quotes) in a response here.

Re: [Ubuntustudio-testers] [Bug 739634] [NEW] FireFox / Youtube can Interrupt the Sound system
Hi Daniel - greetings.

Linux version 2.6.35-28-generic (buildd@allspice) (gcc version 4.4.5 (Ubuntu/Linaro 4.4.4-14ubuntu5) ) #49-Ubuntu SMP Tue Mar 1 14:39:03 UTC 2011
Ubuntu 2.6.35-28.49-generic 2.6.35.11
in response to your info request.

Further to this Bug, I notice that there are stops and starts while watchng YouTube,
and streaming music.
Is there a way of finding out where the bottleneck is ??

Some
monitoring program, or similar, etc ?
I may make a separate Bug Report for this.

Hi Daniel
The buggy machine, below, has a Dell Soundcard
in one of the PCI slots, but I still see it refers to
My good machine only uses the MoBo sound-system.
A lot of the difference I am seeing between these
two machines seem like the system keeps getting
confused as to what is talking to what.
If we can handle some of these niggles, this is
definitely an award winning system in the making.
